title: Guadalupe Valdez
text:
Guadalupe Valdez San Pedro (b. <a href="Mexico%20City">Mexico City</a>, 22 September 1957) is a <a href="Dominican%20Republic">Dominican Republic</a> politician. She was national <a href="deputy%20%28legislator%29">deputy</a> from 2010 to 2016.
Early life.
Valdez was born in <a href="Mexico%20City">Mexico City</a> to Nicolás Quírico Valdez, a <a href="People%20of%20the%20Dominican%20Republic">Dominican</a> labor activist <a href="exile">exile</a>d in <a href="Mexico">Mexico</a>, and Lucía San Pedro, a <a href="Mexicans">Mexican</a> woman. Her father was considered a <a href="communist">communist</a> and was expelled from Mexico and had to seek asylum in the <a href="USSR">USSR</a>. Valdez was raised in her maternal grandmother's home. After the fall of <a href="Rafael%20Trujillo">Rafael Trujillo</a>’s dictatorship in 1961, Lucía San Pedro moved to Santo Domingo with her children, including Guadalupe, to rejoin her husband.
Legislative career.
In 2010, Valdez was elected to the <a href="Chamber%20of%20Deputies%20of%20the%20Dominican%20Republic">Chamber of Deputies of the Dominican Republic</a>.
